title: Sub Question 1
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum
Translation (1 point):

Possible translations are:

· immemores: unmindful/not mindful/mindless/heedless/unheeding/forgetful/forgetting/not remembering/not thinking/oblivious

· fuore: by/from/with/due to/because of madness/insanity/fury/rage/frenzy/anger

· caeci: blind/blinded/unseeing

· -que: and

Identification (1 point):

ablative of means/instrument/cause

title: Sub Question 2
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

Possible answers include: Horse/Trojan Horse/wooden horse built by Greeks (incorrect information specifically about the horse will not be awarded the point.)

title: Sub Question 3
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

Spondee—Spondee—Spondee—Sponde—Dactyl—Spondee

· The line must be completely correct in its scansion. Copying of the Latin need not be perfect. The final foot may be rendered as a spondee, as long-short, as X, or as long-anceps.

· The student may put long and short marks over the Latin syllables or write out the names of each metrical unit as above.

· If the student offers both styles of scansion and they do not match up, then the long and short marks take precedence over the writing out of the words "dactyl" and "spondee".

· The student does not have to mark the elision in the second foot to get credit.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

Spondee—Spondee—Spondee—Sponde—Dactyl—Spondee

· The line must be completely correct in its scansion. Copying of the Latin need not be perfect. The final foot may be rendered as a spondee, as long-short, as X, or as long-anceps.

· The student may put long and short marks over the Latin syllables or write out the names of each metrical unit as above.

· If the student offers both styles of scansion and they do not match up, then the long and short marks take precedence over the writing out of the words "dactyl" and "spondee".

· The student does not have to mark the elision in the second foot to get credit.

Student response earns one of the available points.

Spondee—Spondee—Spondee—Sponde—Dactyl—Spondee

· The line must be completely correct in its scansion. Copying of the Latin need not be perfect. The final foot may be rendered as a spondee, as long-short, as X, or as long-anceps.

· The student may put long and short marks over the Latin syllables or write out the names of each metrical unit as above.

· If the student offers both styles of scansion and they do not match up, then the long and short marks take precedence over the writing out of the words "dactyl" and "spondee".

· The student does not have to mark the elision in the second foot to get credit.

title: Sub Question 4
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum
Possible answers are:

· Trojans/Teucrians/people of Troy
The student may give Latin Nos or miseri or translate as we/us/miserable ones/unhappy people.

title: Sub Question 6
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

Possible answers are:

· To hit Dido with his arrow/To fill Dido with passion/To make Dido fall in love with Aeneas/To cast a love spell

· To protect Aeneas/To help Aeneas (or Trojans)

· To make Dido and the Carthaginians hospitable to Aeneas and the Trojans

· Answer must come from Book 1.
